text: English Singsing
At the Art Museum
Wow! I’ve never seen such a huge art museum!
Tom, it’s not proper etiquette to speak that loudly.
Alright…
Olivia, which art pieces are you looking at now?
It’s the ‘Mona Lisa’ by Leonardo da Vinci!
I’ve always wanted to see this.
This is the famous eyebrow-less Mona Lisa!
I cannot take my eyes off her eyes.
I want to take a picture with her!
No, Tom!
We can’t take pictures in this museum.
Oh, I didn’t know that.
I really wanted to take a photo with her.
Hmm… This painting is a little bit freaky.
Its nose and eyes are twisted and the colors are so unrealistic.
That’s what makes an abstract painting so attractive.
A painter expresses his own unrealistic expressions.
This was painted by the most famous painter, Picasso.
his painting seems like the painter loves the stars and the moon a lot.
This art piece was drawn with repetitive brush touches and fancy color tones.
That’s right.
This is Vincent Van Gogh’s famous piece, ‘The Starry Night.’
What, Tom?
Did you know about this painting?
Nope. I just saw its title at the bottom here.
